welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “Think about the last website you visited—what types of images were used and why? Were they purely decorative or did they convey important information?” Students share with a partner and then open discussion.

aim.data: State the agenda and objective: Learn how to insert images with the tag and use attributes like alt, title, width, and height.

review.data: Recap lists and links from last class. Discuss how an image can be linked to another page.

relevant.data: Mini-lecture on syntax and attributes. Live demo in WebStorm using different image types and responsive design.

interactive.data: Students build a page using 3 images, applying alt, title, width, and height. One image must be styled to be responsive.

ownership.data: Students add a clickable image linking to an external site and push to GitHub Pages.

resonate.data: Exit ticket: What does alt do and why is it important? How can images be responsive?

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, Internet, image folder, GitHub access, project starter code
